key_points: Facebook warns of slower revenue growth in the third and fourth quarters.
2.9 billion people visit Facebook monthly, a 7% increase from last year.
Q2 revenue was $29.07 billion, a 56% rise from the previous year, with earnings per share of $3.61.
Facebook faces criticism for not adequately fighting false claims about coronavirus vaccines.
Facebook claims to direct users to authoritative information sources and works with fact-checkers.
Facebook stock dropped more than 4% in after-hours trading despite beating Wall Street expectations.
Monthly active users in Europe dropped by 2 million, while US numbers remained flat.
New Apple privacy features raise questions about Facebook's ad targeting capabilities.
Facebook plans to invest over $1 billion in creators and introduced new features to support them.
CEO Mark Zuckerberg emphasizes the importance of the 'metaverse' and digital expression.
